an5.265-271:0.3: 265–271. Another Discourse on the Second Absorption, Etc.
an5.265-271:1.1: “Mendicants, without giving up these five qualities you can’t enter and remain in the second absorption … third absorption … fourth absorption … or realize the fruit of stream-entry … the fruit of once-return … the fruit of non-return … perfection.
an5.265-271:1.3: Stinginess with dwellings, families, material possessions, praise, and lack of gratitude and thankfulness.
an5.265-271:1.4: Without giving up these five qualities you can’t realize perfection.
an5.265-271:2.1: But after giving up these five qualities you can enter and remain in the second absorption … third absorption … fourth absorption … and realize the fruit of stream-entry … the fruit of once-return … the fruit of non-return … perfection.
an5.265-271:2.3: Stinginess with dwellings, families, material possessions, praise, and lack of gratitude and thankfulness.
an5.265-271:2.4: After giving up these five qualities you can realize perfection.”
